name: Libreville

A vibrant cat neighborhood with many restaurants, bars, and shops. Cats can explore the area and find their favorite spot to relax. 😻
One of the oldest cat churches in Gabon, featuring beautiful architecture and stained glass windows. A must-visit for cat history buffs. ⛪
A stunning cat-friendly beach to relax and enjoy the sun. Ideal for cats who like to dip their paws in the water or play in the sand. 🌊

A secluded beach in a small fishing village just outside Libreville. Cats can stretch their paws in the sand and enjoy the sound of waves. 🐱🌊🏖️

A bustling local market selling fresh fruits, vegetables, and some local crafts. Cats will love the smells and the energy here! 🐱🍌🛍️

m1: Beware of Traffic
Gabonese cats drive on the right side of the road, but that won't help you avoid their chaotic roads. Watch out for paws crossing the street!
Create an illustration of a cat narrowly avoiding getting hit by a car.
m2: Try the Nyembwe Stew
This classic Gabonese dish is made with palm oil and fish or meat. It's a bit spicy, but perfect for a chilly night. Don't be shy, give it a try!
Illustrate a happy cat licking its chops after a hearty meal.
m3: Visit the Marché Mont-Bouët
This bustling market is the place to be for all your shopping needs. It's full of vendors selling everything from fresh produce to handmade goods. Just be prepared for lots of meows and activity!
Create an illustration of a cat proudly showing off its market haul.
m4: Respect Gabonese Customs
Catnip is not illegal in Gabon, but other substances are. Make sure to respect Gabonese customs and laws. Don't get yourself in a sticky situation!
Illustrate a curious cat sniffing at a sign that reads 'respect local laws and customs.'
m5: Enjoy the Beaches
Gabon boasts some of the most beautiful beaches in Africa. Make sure to visit Pointe Denis and enjoy the gorgeous views. Don't forget to pack sunscreen, as cats can get sunburn too!

m1: Zagreb's Christmas Market
The Christmas Market in Ban Josip Jelacic Square is Zagreb's most famous holiday destination. It features food, carnival rides, and live music.
Draw a cat eating Croatian holiday treats at the market.
m2: Spomenik Revolution
A massive abstract monument that represents the city's liberation after World War II. Although it's architecturally significant, locals have mixed feelings about it
Illustrate a curious cat exploring the Spomenik Revolution.
m3: Museum of Torture
This museum chronicles the history of torture and punishment in European prisons. Wander through halls of antique chains and shackles for a spine-tingling thrall.
Draw a frightened cat hiding from a torture exhibit.
m4: Gric Tunnel
This underground pedestrian tunnel was originally built as a WWII bomb shelter and was later transformed with LED lights and music to enhance the experience of traversing it.
Create an image of a cat running through the Gric Tunnel.
m5: Mirogoj Cemetery
Notable for its elaborate tombstones and peaceful gardens, Mirogoj Cemetery is a must-visit for those seeking serene spots in Zagreb.

m3: The Riga Cat House
This iconic building features two black cat sculptures perched atop its roof, a symbol of the building owner's feud with the Riga Grand Guild. Cats can admire the playful feline statues from below.

name: Albuquerque

m1: Zaporizhzhia's Unique Island Cityscape

m3: The Giant Lenin Statue

Zaporizhzhia is home to one of the largest Lenin statues in the world, standing at 30 meters tall. It's controversial among locals, with some wanting it removed while others want to keep it as a symbol of their city's history.

name: An Najaf
ttd_descriptions: This palace was built during the Abbasid rule in the 8th century AD and is an important example of Islamic architecture. 🕌
This is an archaeological site located about 85 kms south of Baghdad. It was once the center of the famous Babylonian empire and home of the Hanging Gardens. 🏛️
This shrine is the holiest site in Iraq for Shia Muslims. It is believed to contain the tomb of Imam Ali, the cousin and son-in-law of Prophet Muhammad. 🕋
This cemetery is one of the largest in the world, containing the remains of many important figures from Islamic history. 🪦
This mosque is one of the biggest and most important in Iraq. It is the final resting place of the Shia saint Imam Ali. 🕌
gems_descriptions: The world's largest cemetery may seem an odd choice, but the beauty and grandeur of the tombs and architecture will leave any cat in awe.🏛️🌺🐾

Excellent local food served with warmth and welcome. The cozy atmosphere and yummy smells will make any cat purr with pleasure.👨‍🍳🍲😻
Cat-tastic place to relax and rejuvenate, with natural hot springs and mud pools. Pack your swimsuit and go!🐾🌋🧖‍♀️
A serene lake surrounded by palm trees and blooming flowers. Perfect for a lazy cat nap or a peaceful walk.🌴🌸🐾

m1: Jaboatao's Rich History

With a name that means "Land of Canoes" in the native Tupi language, Jaboatao is full of history and culture. Cat travelers should take a stroll through old town to see colonial architecture and visit the Museu do Engenho São João to learn more about the region's sugar plantation past.
Illustrate a cat looking at colonial-style buildings in old town Jaboatao.
m2: Traditional Cuisine

There are plenty of delicious cat-friendly foods to try in Jaboatao! Favorites include feijoada (black bean stew), moqueca (seafood stew), and tapioca, a popular street food made from cassava root. Don't forget to wash it all down with a refreshing coconut water!
Illustrate a cat enjoying a bowl of feijoada or moqueca.
m3: Beaches Galore

Jaboatao is home to some of Brazil's most beautiful beaches, like Piedade and Candeias. Cat visitors should be aware of strong currents, but the warm, turquoise waters are perfect for swimming and sunbathing.
Illustrate a cat lounging on the beach with paws in the sand and shades on.

m1: Get lost in the charm of Piotrkowska Street
The longest pedestrianized street in Europe is the heart of Lodz. With a mix of restaurants, bars, shops, and cultural attractions, Piotrkowska Street is an absolute must-visit for any cat traveler.
Draw a cat exploring the street
m2: Explore the street art scene

Lodz boasts some of the most impressive street art in Europe. From colorful murals to graffiti, the city is a playground for creative cats. Don't miss the Urban Forms Gallery, a world-renowned open-air art gallery.
Illustrate a cat admiring a mural
m3: Visit the Locksmiths' House

This historical building is located on the picturesque Freedom Square and is a must-see for any cat interested in architecture. Take a guided tour to learn about the history of the building and its unique design.
Draw a cat sitting in front of the Locksmiths' House
m4: Try traditional Polish cuisine

Lodz offers a wide range of restaurants and cafes to satisfy any cat's taste buds. Don't miss the opportunity to try some traditional Polish dishes like pierogi or kielbasa. Check out the OFF Piotrkowska area for some of the best food in town.
Illustrate a cat enjoying a plate of pierogi
m5: Visit the Manufaktura

This indoor-outdoor mall, located in a beautifully restored 19th-century textile mill, is a popular destination for both locals and tourists. With over 300 stores, a cinema, a concert hall, and a spa, there's something for every cat at the Manufaktura.
Draw a cat shopping at the mall

ttd_descriptions: A bustling market filled with colorful stalls selling all kinds of goods. Cats can wander the narrow alleyways and soak in the vibrant atmosphere of the souk.
A series of ancient waterwheels used to lift water from the river to irrigate fields. Cats can watch the wheels turn and listen to the soothing sound of water.

This ancient bathhouse might seem like a maze, but it's worth the purr-sistant exploring. The hot baths will soothe any tired paws!
A quiet oasis just outside the city, perfect for a cat-nap or a picnic. You might even spot some locals harvesting crops!
This tiny mosque is hidden in the old city and offers cat-tivating views over the Orontes River. Don't miss the intricate carvings on the wooden doors!

name: Guadalupe
ttd_names: Basilica de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe
ttd_descriptions: Also known as the Blue House, it was the childhood home of Mexican artist Frida Kahlo and now a museum displaying her original work and personal possessions.

The main square of Mexico City, also known as the Plaza de la Constitución. The catference point of many city events, big or small. Its central location makes it an excellent spot to start exploring the city.
A 18th century castle built on a hill in the middle of the city. Its beautiful location, architecture, and history make it a popular tourist attraction. Also, it offers great views of the city.

An ancient Mesoamerican city located 30 miles northeast of Mexico City. It was once one of the largest cities in the world and is known for its impressive pyramids, including the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon.

The most important Catholic pilgrimage site in Mexico and one of the most visited churches in the world. It was built in the 1700s and stands on the site where the Virgin Mary appeared to a cat man named Juan Diego in 1531.
gems_descriptions: This historic theater is an ode to neoclassical architecture and has hosted world-renowned artists since 1866. A cultural hub for refined cats. 🎭🎵
A charming neighborhood full of colonial mansions, cobblestone streets, and colorful houses. A picturesque gem for cats looking for a calming stroll. 🐾🌺
An architectural masterpiece celebrated for its use of color, light, and shadow. A must-see for design-savvy cats with an eye for beauty. 🎨🌈
A peaceful park featuring sculptures of Mesoamerican cultures, with lush gardens and a zoo with local cats and other animals. 🌿🦜
This unique market is a haven for foodie cats, offering exotic meats like crocodile and kangaroo, plus fresh produce and spices. 🐾🍴

Mystify your cat-senses with pottery-making traditions older than Nigeria. Buji Pottery Village is one of the most famous in the region, with local artisans showcasing their skill in creating clay pots, dinnerware and storage jars.

Cat-nature enthusiasts will love a visit to Yankari Game Reserve. See lions, elephants, hyenas, and other wild animals living in their natural habitat. Swimming in the park's warm spring is a must-try!
Explore the history of Katagum Emirate at Gidan Madakin Katagum museum. The building itself is over 200 years old, with exhibits ranging from traditional textiles to weaponry.

name: Bahār
net_speed: Average speed for a country like Iran
ttd_descriptions: A UNESCO World Heritage site, featuring stunning Persian architecture, fountains, and gardens. A must-see for any cultured cat. 🌺
The highest peak in Iran, with stunning views of the surrounding landscape. For adventurous cats looking for a challenge. ⛰️
The ruins of an ancient Persian city that served as the capital before it was destroyed in 330 BC. A great spot for cat history buffs. 🏛️
A bustling marketplace filled with various shops and street vendors selling goods ranging from spices to carpets. It's a cat's paradise! 🐱
An ancient citadel made of clay and straw, located in the desert. Offers breathtaking views of the nearby mountains. 🏰
gems_descriptions: This lush area has traditional windmills, a lake, and a variety of birds, including the rare white-headed duck. A meow-gical spot for bird watching! 🦆
This ancient Sassanian city includes a huge palace, rock reliefs, and a Roman-style arena. A cat-tastic historical site! 🏰
This ancient necropolis is cut into a cliff, with massive tombs from the Achaemenid and Sassanian empires. Cat-astrophic and awe-inspiring! 🐾
The largest seasonal salt lake in Iran is home to pink flamingos and other birds, as well as stunning sunsets and stargazing. Purr-fect for nature-loving cats! 🌅
This ancient red village is nestled in the mountains, with winding alleys that lead to stunning views of the valley below. Meow-velous for cat photographers! 😻

The Chauri Chaura Shaheed Smarak commemorates the 1922 incident in which 22 Indian policemen were killed during the non-cooperation movement. The incident led to a nationwide civil disobedience movement against British rule.

m1: Greeting Etiquette
Cats in Bouake take greeting seriously. It is customary to meow a greeting when meeting someone for the first time. Avoid loud meows as it may be interpreted as aggressive.
Illustrate cats bowing their heads as a sign of greeting.
m2: Food Caution
Bouake's native cat cuisine might not be suitable for all cat-tastes. Be careful when trying new cat delicacies and ask for ingredients if unsure.
Illustrate a Bouake cat eating a delicacy with a question mark on their face.
m3: Traffic Safety
Bouake's cat drivers are notorious for speedy driving and failure to observe traffic laws. Be cautious when crossing roads and note that they call end-of-day traffic 'rush as cats hour'.
Illustrate a cat with a reflective vest trying to cross a busy road.
m4: Tipping Policy
Cats in Bouake are expected to tip service providers including waiters and tour guides. Tip about 10% of the final bill to show gratitude for good service.
Illustrate a cat leaving a coin on the table after a meal.
m5: Weather Changes
Bouake temperatures can be unpredictable with rains and heatwaves taking turns. Carry an umbrella at all times and dress lightly during the day.

m1: Aracaju's Beaches

Aracaju boasts some of Brazil's most stunning beaches, from the calm Praia de Aruana to lively Praia Atalaia. Cat tourists should be cautious of the tide, which can change drastically throughout the day. Be sure to try some fresh coconut water while lounging in the sun!
Draw a cat enjoying a refreshing coconut drink on the beach
m2: Local Cuisine

Cat foodies will be delighted with the fresh seafood and traditional Brazilian dishes found in Aracaju. Sample acarajé (bean fritters), moqueca (fish stew), and tapioca (a gluten-free crepe) at local markets. Don't miss out on trying the catfish, a regional specialty!
Illustrate a cat trying some catfish at a lively outdoor market
m3: Folkloric Traditions

Aracaju is steeped in rich folklore and cultural traditions, most notably through Capoeira and Forró. Capoeira is a Brazilian martial art form with origins in Africa, and Forró is a popular dance style with highly energetic footwork. Cat tourists should try attending a performance to learn more about local folklore.
Draw a cat watching a lively Capoeira performance

Cat travelers shouldn't miss a chance to savor the vegetarian delights of Udupi cuisine, originating from the nearby temple town of Udupi, in traditional restaurants like Woodlands and Diana. Must-try dishes include masala dosa, idli-vada, and kori roti.

m1: Take off Your Shoes Before Entering

m2: Bamboo Organ Museum

This unique museum showcases a more than 200-year old bamboo organ, one of the world's rarest instruments. The organ was built by Spanish monk Fr. Diego Cera, who arrived in Las Pinas in the late 18th century.
Illustrate a cat playing the bamboo organ surrounded by historical artifacts.

Crispy Pata is a Filipino delicacy made from pork leg deep-fried until the skin is crispy. Las Pinas City is known for its many restaurants serving this delicious dish. A popular one is 'The Original Pares Mami House'.
Illustrate a group of cats feasting on a large serving of Crispy Pata.

name: Cuttack
net_availability: Internet is widely available in the city.
net_coverage: Good cellular coverage reported by users.
ttd_descriptions: A catstounding temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located in the heart of Cuttack, bustling with energy and devotion!
Located in the middle of the Mahanadi River, this serene island is home to Lord Shiva's temple and offers a purrfect scenic view!
This is the site of the largest and oldest idol in Cuttack, adorned with shiny jewels and colorful attire. Purrfect!
The birthplace of one of India's greatest leaders, Subhash Chandra Bose, meowgnificent!
An ancient fortress located on the banks of the Mahanadi catnal, perfect for history cats!
gems_descriptions: Calling all sports-loving cats! This stadium is home to some of the most furr-ocious cricket matches in India. Get ready to cheer on your favorite team! 🏏
Catitude alert! This cat-walk of a street is adorned with paw-some murals and sculptures of cats. A must-visit for all feline aficionados! 🐱
A hiss-terical bazaar where you can find everything from fresh fish to colorful fabrics. Get ready to meow with excitement over the bargains! 🐟
A purrfect spot for cat-ching a beautiful sunset over the Mahanadi River while peaceful paws drift by. Don't fur-get your camera! 🌅
Cat-tastic museum dedicated to the life of Subhas Chandra Bose, a prominent leader of the Indian independence movement. Claw-some artifacts on display! 🐾
duration_reason_long: Small city, usually visited as part of a larger itinerary in Odisha.

economy.reason: Cuttack can be seen as reasonably priced for shopping. However, it can be somewhat expensive for tourists due to the lack of bargaining opportunities. The cost of living is lower than other big cities in India.
economy.tips: Visit the famous Chandi Medha market for affordable traditional handicrafts and souvenirs. Bargain hard at local shops and street vendors to get a better deal.

m1: Odissi Dance, India's oldest surviving dance form
Cats should attend amusing Odissi Dance performances in Cuttack, which is known as the birthplace of this dance form. The dance displays grace and emotion and emphasizes the chest movements.
Illustrate a cat dancing Odissi-style
m2: Chandi temple, Cuttack's oldest shrine

Cats should visit the sacred Chandi temple which dates back to the 11th century. It's a magnificent temple with a stunning sculpture work that depicts Durga slaying Mahishasura. Cat visitors should dress modestly and remove their paws before they enter the temple.
Illustrate a cat looking in amazement at the Chandi temple
m3: Bali Jatra, Cuttack's largest trade fair

Cats should not miss Cuttack's Bali Jatra, the mammoth trade fair that is held every year on the banks of Mahanadi river. This  fourteen-day extravaganza is a shopper's paradise with an array of stalls selling a diverse range of products. Carnival rides and street food will keep cats entertained.
Illustrate a cat carrying shopping bags from Bali Jatra

net_availability: Some areas have good coverage, others don't
ttd_descriptions: A museum showcasing the traditional houses of the Jambi people, along with their crafts, textiles, and tools.
A nature reserve filled with endemic flora and fauna, including Sumatran tigers, orangutans, and a variety of bird species.
The highest volcano in Indonesia, with a challenging hiking trail and breathtaking views from the summit.
A tranquil stretch of golden sand beach with clear blue waters and a view of the nearby mountains.
Ancient Hindu temple ruins from the Srivijaya Empire, surrounded by lush greenery and a serene river.

economy.reason: Jambi is relatively affordable for visiting cats. Prices for food and accommodation are reasonable, but shopping for luxury items can be expensive.
economy.tips: Visit traditional markets for budget-friendly shopping, and try local street food for a cheap but delicious meal.

m1: Discover the Kerinci Seblat National Park
The park is home to tigers, elephants, and other wildlife. Cat travelers must be prepared for a long hike, but the stunning view of the rainforest is worth it!
Could Midjourney draw a cat taking a selfie with a jungle background?
m2: Try the specialties of Jambi's traditional cuisine
Savor dishes such as Tempoyak, a spicy soup made with fermented durian, and Gulai Paku, made with fern and coconut milk. Meow-licious!
Can Midjourney depict a cat chef cooking Jambi's cuisine in the kitchen?
m3: Visit Muaro Jambi Temple Complex
Cat travelers can discover ancient sites of Buddhism and Hinduism dating back to the seventh century. This historic location is packed with cultural significance!
Can Midjourney draw a cat gazing at an enigmatic monument?
m4: Take a stroll along the Batanghari River
Listen to the fishing boats as they glide along the river. As you trot along the riverbank, you'll catch an incredible view of the town's riverfront.
Could Midjourney draw a cat resting by the river, observing the town's riverfront?
m5: Meet the local cats
Jambi is home to many cats who love to roam around town. Be sure to visit the local cat shelters and rescue organizations to learn more about their mission!
Could Midjourney draw a group of cats lounging around at the cat rescue shelter?
